CCEP Manager
  • »
  • User interface
  • View page source

User interface

CCEP Manager interface primarly consists of an interactive table, which shows for each patient the status of each step forming the processing pipeline. Cells are selectable and a number of contextual actions can be performed on the active selection, such as processing the data, viewing detailed step information, or exploring results using dedicated tools.

1 - App management: Administer the application.
2 - BIDS management: Select/refresh the active BIDS database.
3 - Pipeline Management: Interactive table to process and explore data.

Parameters

Application parameters are accessible by clicking .

1 - Dependencies: Specify the paths to external softwares.
2 - Report: Send a bug report.
3 - Cite: Authoring information and references.
4 - Info: Licensing information.

BIDS database

The active BIDS database is specified by clicking and then selecting the root directory of the appropriate BIDS database.

1 - Home: Path to the active BIDS database.
2 - Browse: Specify the active BIDS database.
3 - Refresh: Refresh the interactive table.

Filters

It is possible to filter the interactive table by clicking at the top of the subject list.

1 - Name: Filter the table by subject name.
2 - BIDS: Filter the table using BIDS entities.
3 - Status: Filter the table depdending on step status.
4 - Reset: Reset filters.
5 - Apply: Apply filters.

It is also possible to filter processing steps depending on their status clicking the buttons accessible on top of each column of the interactive table.

Tools

Each step produces substantially different outputs which can be explored using tools accessible by clicking . The tools available differ depending on the processing step.

1 - Time series: Visualize time series with AnyWave.
2 - CCEP: Visualize CCEP in 3D with HiBoP.
3 - Features (not shown): Extract CCEP features in text files.

Toolbar

The toolbar is used to quickly (un)-select cells from the interactive table and reset filters.

1 - Reset flters: Reset all filters.
2 - Clear selection: Clear the active selection.
3 - Vertical selection: Toggle vertical selection mode.
4 - Horizontal selection: Toggle horizontal selection mode.

Contextual actions

Cells from the interactive table are selectable and a number of contextual actions are accessible after right clicking the active selection.

1 - Open: Open the step directory in the file browser.
2 - Explore: View detailed step information.
3 - Run: Process the step.
4 - Delete: Delete all data related to the step.

Explore

The EXPLORE option () is used to display more in depth information regarding the status of processing steps. The subjects and steps appearing depend on the selection made in the interactive table.

1 - Subject list: List of selectable subjects.
2 - Path: Path to the step directory.
3 - Sessions: Processed BIDS session(s).
4 - General status: General status of the step.
5 - Detailed status: Detailed status of the step. Session-wise status.
6 - Inputs/ouputs: step dependent input/output files.
IMPLANTATION: List of implantation files with matching status.
PREPROCESSING: List of iEEG files with preprocessing status.
CROPPING: List of cropped stimulation files with quality control status.
FEATURES: List of cropped stimulations files with features extraction status.
7 - Last: Date of the last execution.
8 - Reports: List of execution reports.

Run

The RUN option () is used to configure and execute processing steps. The subjects and steps appearing depend on the selection made in the interactive table. The description of the processing steps and associated parameters can be found in the dedicated chapter.

1 - Run: Start processing data.
2 - Force: Toggle to bypass checkups before execution.
3 - Clean: Toggle to delete the output folder before execution.
4 - Subject list: List of selectable subjects.
5 - Step parameters: Tabs to configure the steps for the active subject.
IMPLANTATIION: Implantation step parameters.
PREPROCESSING: Preprocessing step parameters.
CROPPING: Cropping step parameters.
FEATURES: Features step parameters.
6 - Clear: Clear the console.
7 - Save: Save the console in a text file.
